f4b5da09-40ff-4df2-9e82-60831e716b9f.description: FS-ISAC's Women in Cyber Scholarship is earned by rising young women pursuing cybersecurity careers in financial services in the United States, Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, or Africa. Winners receive a $10,000 USD scholarship, mentorship directly from an industry expert, and free attendance, travel, and accommodations to an FS-ISAC Summit or event.
f4b5da09-40ff-4df2-9e82-60831e716b9f.name: FS-ISAC 2022 Women in Cyber Scholarship Winner

badge_template_activities.title: Winners display an excellent dedication to the cybersecurity of financial services.

041ff4c8-daf6-422c-9981-3b32cd607e4a.description: The mission of the FS-ISAC Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) Working Group is to research, develop, and share information and strategies that will assist the financial sector in becoming quantum-resistant before the threat of quantum cryptanalysis can be used by threats actors, putting the sector at risk.
041ff4c8-daf6-422c-9981-3b32cd607e4a.name: Founding Member: FS-ISAC Post-Quantum Cryptography Working Group

badge_template_activities.title: Founding members showcase leadership in advancing cybersecurity and resilience in the global financial system by coming together with a passion and common focus of PQC to assist their firms and the sector.

5ea0ca71-ff3f-47f6-88c3-f7e8980149df.description: The FS-ISAC Global Leaders awards program recognizes those members who go above and beyond to support the security and resilience of the financial sector by sharing cyber intel and best practices, helping defend the industry against cyber risks. FS-ISAC Global Intelligence Office verified nominations and selected finalists.
5ea0ca71-ff3f-47f6-88c3-f7e8980149df.name: FS-ISAC 2021 Global Leaders Finalist

badge_template_activities.title: Finalists demonstrate exceptional contribution to FS-ISAC's mission of sharing cyber intelligence and best practices to reduce cyber risk in the global financial system.

Finalists contribute to the FS-ISAC community in one or more of the following areas: Intelligence – sharing threats, tools, technologies, and analytical capabilities that help us strengthen our collective defenses Resilience – outstanding contributions to our cyber defense exercises Building trust in the ecosystem – presenting valuable insight and/or best practices at FS-ISAC events

002f0005-1710-4577-b425-43db60acf68f.description: Launched in 2016, the Women in Cyber Scholarship is 100 percent funded through the generosity of FS-ISAC members. Through contributing sponsorships, firms provide both financial support and mentorship to rising young women pursuing cybersecurity careers in financial services in the United States, Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, or Africa.
002f0005-1710-4577-b425-43db60acf68f.name: FS-ISAC 2022 Women in Cyber Scholarship Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Mentors display dedication to providing financial support and mentorship to rising young women pursuing cybersecurity careers in financial services across the world.

bb3aec67-3b48-4ed8-b52a-dc2518285bf4.description: The FS-ISAC Global Leaders awards program recognizes those members who go above and beyond to support the security and resilience of the financial sector by sharing cyber intel and best practices, helping defend the industry against cyber risks. FS-ISAC Global Intelligence Office verified nominations and selected winners. FS-ISAC Board of Directors voted for one winner per region (NAM, LATAM, EMEA, and APAC).
bb3aec67-3b48-4ed8-b52a-dc2518285bf4.name: FS-ISAC 2021 Global Leaders Winner

badge_template_activities.title: Winners demonstrate outstanding contribution to FS-ISAC's mission of sharing cyber intelligence and best practices to reduce cyber risk in the global financial system.

Winners contribute to the FS-ISAC community in one or more of the following areas: Intelligence – sharing threats, tools, technologies, and analytical capabilities that help us strengthen our collective defenses Resilience – outstanding contributions to our cyber defense exercises Building trust in the ecosystem – presenting valuable insight and/or best practices at FS-ISAC events.

7703a3a1-b300-4599-8292-16f924e52e54.description: The mission of the FS-ISAC Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) Working Group is to research, develop, and share information and strategies that will assist the financial sector in becoming quantum-resistant before the threat of quantum cryptanalysis can be used by threats actors, putting the sector at risk.
7703a3a1-b300-4599-8292-16f924e52e54.name: Co Vice-Chair: FS-ISAC Post-Quantum Cryptography Working Group

badge_template_activities.title: Co vice-chairs showcase leadership in advancing cybersecurity and resilience in the global financial system by assisting in leading the PQC Working Group.

8ae5f0a9-499e-42fd-a096-612a0683f2ee.description: The mission of the FS-ISAC Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) Working Group is to research, develop, and share information and strategies that will assist the financial sector in becoming quantum-resistant before the threat of quantum cryptanalysis can be used by threats actors, putting the sector at risk.
8ae5f0a9-499e-42fd-a096-612a0683f2ee.name: Chair: FS-ISAC Post-Quantum Cryptography Working Group

badge_template_activities.title: The chair showcases leadership in advancing cybersecurity and resilience in the global financial system by leading and helping set the direction of the PQC Working Group.

017685ca-b30f-4c1a-b2de-b2a20343fe8b.description: The FS-ISAC Global Leaders awards program recognizes those members who go above and beyond to support the security and resilience of the financial sector by sharing cyber intelligence and knowledge, helping defend the industry against cyber risks. FS-ISAC Board of Directors voted for one winner per region (NAM, LATAM, EMEA, and APAC).
017685ca-b30f-4c1a-b2de-b2a20343fe8b.name: FS-ISAC 2022 Global Leaders Winner

badge_template_activities.title: Winners demonstrate commitment to advancing cybersecurity and resilience in the global financial system through cross-border collaboration, cyber intelligence sharing, and defense against emerging cyber threats.

Winners contribute to the FS-ISAC community in one or more of the following areas: Intelligence – sharing intelligence that helps others prevent and defend against attacks. Resilience – contributing to our exercises, training, and incident response activities. Trust - sharing insights or best practices at events; suggesting service innovations that increase the value of membership and build the ecosystem.
